Description: Leader
Record status. Use "n" (new) as all records in Access has no creation date.
Sources From Access Database: Nil

SQLFrom: ItemType INNER JOIN Item ON ItemType.ItemTypeID = Item.ItemTypeID

Sources From Access Database: Item-->ItemTypeID, need to get the real value from ItemType table. Value need conversion, see ItemType worksheet

SQLFrom: BiblioLevel INNER JOIN Item ON BiblioLevel.BiblioLevelID = Item.BiblioLevelID
Description: Bibliographic level
Sources From Access Database: Item-->BiblioLevelID, need to get the real value from BiblioLevel table.

Description: Character coding scheme. Use “a” (Unicode)
Sources From Access Database: Nil

Description: Encoding level. Blank this field
Sources From Access Database: Nil

Description: Descriptive cataloging form. Use “a” (AACR2)
Sources From Access Database: Nil

SQLFrom: Item
Description: Date entered on file (yymmdd)
Sources From Access Database: Item-->LastUpdate. This is the only date info available in MSAccess db.

SQLFrom: DateType INNER JOIN Item ON DateType.DateTypeID = Item.DateTypeID
Description: Type of date
Sources From Access Database: Item-->DateTypeID, need to get the real value from DateType table. Value is compatible with MARC standard

SQLFrom: Item
Description: Date 1
Sources From Access Database: Item-->Date1

SQLFrom: Item
Description: Date 2
Sources From Access Database: Item-->Date2

SQLFrom: Item
Description: Place of publication, production or execution
Sources From Access Database: Item-->PubCountryCode

SQLFrom: Item
Description: Illustrations
Sources From Access Database:
Mark the appropriate value with the value  from Item-->IllustrativeMatter.
“a” illustrations
“b” maps

SQLFrom: Item

Description: Frequency (For Serial)
Sources From Access Database: Item-->FrequencyID. However there is no data in this field.

Description: Target audience. Blank this field
Sources From Access Database: Nil

SQLFrom: MediaType INNER JOIN Item ON MediaType.MediaTypeID = Item.MediaTypeID
Description: Form of item
Sources From Access Database: Item-->MediaTypeID, need to get the real value from MediaType table. Value need conversion, see MediaType worksheet

Description: Nature of contents
Sources From Access Database:
Mark the appropriate value from with the value from 245 (Title)
“b” bibliographies
“d” dictionaries, glossaries, gazetteers
“e” encyclopedias
“m” theses, see 502
“s” statics
**Empty as it is hard to determine the field.

Description: Government publication. Put “#” as we have no government.
Sources From Access Database: Nil

Description: Conference publication. Blank this field
Sources From Access Database: Nil

Description: Festschrift. Blank this field
Sources From Access Database: Nil

SQLFrom: [Note] INNER JOIN Item ON Item.ItemID = [Note].ItemID
Description: Index
Sources From Access Database:
Mark the appropriate value with the value  from 5xx
"0" if no index present
"1" index present
Need to check with 5xx when doing the data conversion

Description: Undefined (Blank)
Sources From Access Database: Nil

Description: Literary form. Put "0" (Not fiction)
Sources From Access Database: Nil

Description: Biography. Put "0" (not biographical material) first as the MS Access database has no designated field
Sources From Access Database: Nil

Description: Language code
Sources From Access Database: The nearest field is ItemLanguage. However we don't know which is the language of work and which indicate the language talks about in the work. Also it needs to take time to translate the value from our code to MARC language code

Description: Modified record. Blank for this field (record not modified)
Sources From Access Database: Nil

Description: Cataloging source. Use “d” (not one of the above)
Sources From Access Database: Nil

ISBN
1st ind. Blank
2nd ind. Blank
$a ISBN (NR)

SQLFrom: Item
Item
Description:
ISSN

Item-->ISSN=$a

Description:
Cataloging source
1st ind. Blank

SQLFrom: Item INNER JOIN (Holding INNER JOIN ClassNumber ON ClassNumber.ClassNumberID = Holding.ClassNumberID) ON Item.ItemID = Holding.ItemID
Description:
Dewey Decimal classification number
1st ind. Put "0" (Full edition)
2nd ind. =4 (Assigned by agency other than LC)
$a Classification number ®
Sources From Access Database: Holding-->ClassNumberID. Need to get the real value from ClassNumber table

SQLFrom: Name INNER JOIN (Item INNER JOIN ItemName ON Item.ItemID = ItemName.ItemID) ON Name.NameID = ItemName.NameID
Description:
Personal name main entry
1st ind. Type of personal name entry element. 0=Forename, 1=Surname, 3=Family name
2nd ind. Blank
$a Personal name (NR)
$q Fuller form of name (NR)
$b Numeration (NR)
,$c Titles and other words associated with a name
,$d Dates associated with a name (NR)
Sources From Access Database:
ItemName-->Name-->FormofEntry where NameTypeID=2  =1st ind.  Value needs conversion
ItemName-->Name-->LastName + "," + FirstName = $a
ItemName-->Name-->NamePrefix=$c
ItemName-->Name-->YearOfBirth=$d
OldCode: "$a" & IIf([Name]![FormofEntry]=0,Trim([Name]![FirstName] & " " & [Name]![LastName]) & IIf(Right([Name]![FirstName] & [Name]![LastName],1)<>".","."),Trim([Name]![LastName]) & IIf([Name]![FirstName] Is Not Null,", " & Trim([Name]![FirstName])) & IIf(Right([Name]![LastName] & [Name]![FirstName],1)<>".",".")) & IIf([Name]![FullerName]<>"","$q(" & Trim([Name]![FullerName]) & ")") & IIf([Name]![YearOfBirth]<>"",",$d" & Trim([Name]![YearOfBirth]))

SQLFrom: Name INNER JOIN (Item INNER JOIN ItemName ON Item.ItemID = ItemName.ItemID) ON Name.NameID = ItemName.NameID
SQLWhere: ItemName.NameSequence = 1 AND Name.NameTypeID = 2 AND ItemName.FunctionID = 2 AND Name.FullerName <> 'None'
Description:
Personal name main entry
1st ind. Type of personal name entry element. 0=Forename, 1=Surname, 3=Family name
2nd ind. Blank
$a Personal name (NR)
$q Fuller form of name (NR)
$b Numeration (NR)
,$c Titles and other words associated with a name
,$d Dates associated with a name (NR)
Sources From Access Database:
ItemName-->Name-->FormofEntry where NameTypeID=2  =1st ind.  Value needs conversion
ItemName-->Name-->LastName + "," + FirstName = $a
ItemName-->Name-->NamePrefix=$c
ItemName-->Name-->YearOfBirth=$d

SQLFrom: Name INNER JOIN (Item INNER JOIN ItemName ON Item.ItemID = ItemName.ItemID) ON Name.NameID = ItemName.NameID
Description:
Personal name main entry
1st ind. Type of personal name entry element. 0=Forename, 1=Surname, 3=Family name
2nd ind. Blank
$a Personal name (NR)
$q Fuller form of name (NR)
$b Numeration (NR)
,$c Titles and other words associated with a name
,$d Dates associated with a name (NR)
Sources From Access Database:
ItemName-->Name-->FormofEntry where NameTypeID=2  =1st ind.  Value needs conversion
ItemName-->Name-->LastName + "," + FirstName = $a

SQLFrom: Name INNER JOIN (Item INNER JOIN ItemName ON Item.ItemID = ItemName.ItemID) ON Name.NameID = ItemName.NameID
Description:
Corporate name main entry
1st ind. Put "2" (Name in direct order)
2nd ind. Type of added entry, blank for no information provided
$a Corporate name or jurisdiction name as entry element (NR)
.$b Each subordinate unit in a hierarchy (R)
Sources From Access Database: ItemName-->Name where NameTypeID=3. Name data needs re-arrangement.

SQLFrom: Name INNER JOIN (Item INNER JOIN ItemName ON Item.ItemID = ItemName.ItemID) ON Name.NameID = ItemName.NameID
SQLWhere: (((Name.LastName) Is Not Null) AND ((Name.NameTypeID)=4) AND ((ItemName.NameSequence)=1) AND ((ItemName.FunctionID)=2)) OR (((Name.NameTypeID)=4) AND ((ItemName.NameSequence)=1) AND ((ItemName.FunctionID)=12))
Description:
Meeting name main entry
1st ind. Put "2" (Name in direct order)
2nd ind. Type of added entry, blank for no information provided
$a Meeting name or jurisdiction name as entry element (NR)
$n Number of meeting (R)
$c Location of meeting -- when given outside parentheses (NR)
#:$c Location of meeting -- when given inside parentheses (NR)
$d Date of meeting -- when given outside parentheses (R)
#:$d Date of meeting -- when given inside parentheses (R)
.$e Subordinate unit entered under a meeting name (R)
Sources From Access Database: ItemName-->Name where NameTypeID=4. Name data needs re-arrangement.
OldCode: Trim([Name]![LastName]) & IIf([Name]![NamePrefix]<>"","$c" & Trim([Name]![NamePrefix])) & IIf(Right(Trim([Name]![LastName]) & IIf([Name]![NamePrefix]<>"","$c" & Trim([Name]![NamePrefix])),1)<>".",".")

SQLFrom: Name INNER JOIN (Item INNER JOIN ItemName ON Item.ItemID = ItemName.ItemID) ON Name.NameID = ItemName.NameID
SQLWhere: (((Name.LastName) Is Not Null) AND ((Name.NameTypeID)=4) AND ((ItemName.NameSequence)=1) AND ((ItemName.FunctionID)=2)) OR (((Name.NameTypeID)=4) AND ((ItemName.NameSequence)=1) AND ((ItemName.FunctionID)=12))
Description:
Meeting name main entry
1st ind. Put "2" (Name in direct order)
2nd ind. Type of added entry, blank for no information provided
$a Meeting name or jurisdiction name as entry element (NR)
$n Number of meeting (R)
$c Location of meeting -- when given outside parentheses (NR)
#:$c Location of meeting -- when given inside parentheses (NR)
$d Date of meeting -- when given outside parentheses (R)
#:$d Date of meeting -- when given inside parentheses (R)
.$e Subordinate unit entered under a meeting name (R)
Sources From Access Database: ItemName-->Name where NameTypeID=4. Name data needs re-arrangement.

SQLFrom: Item INNER JOIN Title ON Item.ItemID = Title.ItemID
Description:
Uniform main title entry
1st ind. Nonfiling characters
2nd ind. Blank
$a Uniform title (NR)
$p Name of part/section of a work (R)
$l language of work (NR)
$f Date of work (NR)
$s Version - or edition of a work (NR)
Sources From Access Database:
Title-->TitleTypeID=12
Title-->TitleOffset = 1st ind.
Title-->TitleText = $a
Title-->MARCother append to the end of $a, needs conversion of some control characters

SQLFrom: Item INNER JOIN Title ON Item.ItemID = Title.ItemID
Description:
Uniform title
1st ind. Put “1” (Display specifications)
2nd ind. Nonfiling characters
$a Uniform title (NR)
$p Name of part/section of a work ®
$l language of work (NR)
$f Date of work (NR)
$s Version - or edition of a work (NR)
Sources From Access Database:
Title-->TitleTypeID = 16
Title-->TitleOffset = 2nd ind.
Title-->TitleText = $a
Title-->MARCother append to the end of $a, needs conversion of some control characters

SQLFrom: Item INNER JOIN Title ON Item.ItemID = Title.ItemID
Description:
Translation of Title by Cataloging Agency
1st ind. Title added entry (0=No title added entry, 1=Title added entry)
2nd ind. Non-filing characters
$a Title (NR)
$b Remainder of the title (NR)
$c Remainder of title page transcription/statement of responsibility (NR)
$y Language code of translated title (NR)
Sources From Access Database:
Title-->TitleTypeID=5 or 10
Title-->TitleOffset = 2nd ind.
Title-->TitleText = $a
End with period "." before the field $y
Title-->Title_Language = $y

SQLFrom: Item
Description:
Title statement
1st ind. Put “0” (Do not index as a title added entry)
2nd Nonfiling characters
$a Title proper (NR)
$n Number of part or section(R), or
#=$b Parallel title (NR)
#:$b Other title information (NR)
#/$c Statement of responsibility (NR)
Ending with "."
Sources From Access Database:
Item-->TitleOffset = 2nd ind.
Item-->MainTitle = $a,b. Need to separate data in this field to $a & $b
Item-->StatementofResp = $c

*Beware about the field length limit in Access DB.

#:$b Other title information (NR)
#/$c Statement of responsibility (NR)
Ending with "."
Sources From Access Database:
Item-->TitleOffset = 2nd ind.
Item-->MainTitle = $a,b. Need to separate data in this field to $a & $b
Item-->StatementofResp = $c

SQLFrom: Item

Title statement

#:$b Other title information (NR)

SQLFrom: Item INNER JOIN Title ON Item.ItemID = Title.ItemID
Description:
Varying form of title
1st ind. Put “1” (Display and index)
2nd ind. There are 1-8 for different case. See the catalog manual
2nd ind. = 4 (Cover title)
$a Title proper (NR)
$p Number of part or section ®
#:$b Remainder of title (NR)
Sources From Access Database:
Cover title:
Title-->TitleTypeID = 3
Title-->TitleText = $a
Usually inf from notes. Needs browse through the note field of the record.

SQLFrom: Item
Description:
Edition statement
No ind.
$a Edition statement
Sources From Access Database: Item--> Edition

SQLFrom: PublisherPlace INNER JOIN (Publisher INNER JOIN (Item INNER JOIN ItemPublisher ON Item.ItemID = ItemPublisher.ItemID) ON Publisher.PublisherID = ItemPublisher.PublisherID) ON PublisherPlace.PublisherPlaceID = ItemPublisher.PublisherPlaceID
Description:
Publications, distribution, etc.
1st ind. Blank for monograph; Blank for Serial for earliest available publisher
2nd ind. Blank, undefined
$a Place of publication, distribution, etc. (R)
#:$b Name of publisher (R)
,$c Date of publication, distribution, etc. (R)
Ending with "."
Sources From Access Database:
ItemPublisher-->pubplace-->PublisherPlaceName=$a
ItemPublisher-->Publisher-->PublisherName=$b
Item-->Date1=$c

*Beware of the sequence of publisher in record

SQLSelect: Iif([Item]![Extent]<>'','$a' & Trim([Item]![Extent])) & Iif([Item]![IllustrativeMatter]<>'',':$b' & Trim([Item]![IllustrativeMatter])) & Iif([Item]![OtherMaterial]<>'','+$e' & Trim([Item]![OtherMaterial]))
SQLFrom: Item
Description:
Physical description
Indicators: Blank
$a Extent of item/Play time if appropriate (R)
#:$b Other physical details (R)
#+$e Accompanying material (NR)
Sources From Access Database:
Item-->Extent=$a
Item-->IllustrativeMatter=$b
Item-->Size=$c
Item-->OtherMaterial=$e

SQLFrom: Series INNER JOIN (Item INNER JOIN ItemSeries ON Item.ItemID = ItemSeries.ItemID) ON Series.SeriesID = ItemSeries.SeriesID
Description:
Series statement/Series added entry (Index)
1st ind. Blank
2nd ind. Non-filing characters
$a Series title proper (NR)
.$n Number of part or section of a series (R)
Or ,$p Name of part or section of a series (R)
,$x ISSN of series (NR)
#;$v Volume number/sequential designation (NR)
Sources From Access Database:
Series-->SeriesText = $a
Series-->ISSN = $x
Item-->SequentialDesignation = $v

SQLFrom: Item INNER JOIN [Note] ON Item.ItemID = [Note].ItemID
Description:
General note
Field 500 may have number of content:
a. Accompany material note
b. Edition and history note
c. Index note
d. Item described note
e. Nature, scope, or artistic form note
f. Numbers note
g. Parallel and other title information note
h. Physical description note
i. Publication, distribution, etc., note
j. Series note
k. Source of title proper note
l. Statement of responsibility note
m. Type of extent of resource note (ER)
n. Unformatted contents note
o. Variant title note

Indicators  Blank
$a General note
Sources From Access Database: Note-->NoteText where CommentType=500 = $a

SQLFrom: Item INNER JOIN [Note] ON Item.ItemID = Note.ItemID
Description:
Dissertation note

SQLFrom: Item INNER JOIN [Note] ON Item.ItemID = Note.ItemID

Formatted contents note

2nd ind. Level of content designation, blank for “basic”

Summary note

SQLFrom: Subject INNER JOIN (Item INNER JOIN ItemSubject ON Item.ItemID = ItemSubject.ItemID) ON Subject.SubjectID = ItemSubject.SubjectID

Corporate name subject heading

$x General subdivision
$z Geographical subdivision

SQLFrom: Item INNER JOIN Title ON Item.ItemID = Title.ItemID

Uniform title subject heading

$p Name of part/section of a work
$x general subdivision

Title-->TitleTypeID=15
Title-->TitleOffset = 1st ind.
Title-->TitleText = $a

SQLFrom: Subject INNER JOIN (Item INNER JOIN ItemSubject ON Item.ItemID = ItemSubject.ItemID) ON Subject.SubjectID = ItemSubject.SubjectID

Topical subject heading

2nd ind. Put “0” (LC subject headings)
$a Topical term (NR)
$x General subdivision (R)

Electronic location and access

Ethnologue code

$x Comments
Sources From Access Database: ItemLanguage-->LanguageID. Need to get the real value from Language table

SQLSelect: '$70$4' & IIf([Holding]![Status]='R',1,0) & '$00$2ddc$b' & Choose([Holding]![LocationID],'','BKK','CMX') & '$yBKS$1' & IIf([Holding]![Status]='M',1,0) & '$o' & Trim([ClassNumber]![ClassNumberText] & ' ' & [Holding]![ItemPart]) & '$a' & Choose([Holding]![InventoryLocID],'','BKK','CMX') & '$p' & Trim([Holding]![HoldingNumber]) & IIf([ShelfLocation]![ShelfLocationName]<>'???','$c' & Trim([ShelfLocation]![ShelfLocationName])) & '$d' & Format([Holding]![LastUpdate],'yyyy-mm-dd') & IIf([Holding]![Enumeration]<>'','$h' & [Holding]![Enumeration]) & IIf(Len([Holding]![HoldingNumber])>6,Switch(Right([Holding]![HoldingNumber],1)='b','$t2',Right([Holding]![HoldingNumber],1)='c','$t3',Right([Holding]![HoldingNumber],1)='d','$t4',Right([Holding]![HoldingNumber],1)='e','$t5',Right([Holding]![HoldingNumber],1)='f','$t6',Right([Holding]![HoldingNumber],1)='g','$t7')) & IIf([Holding]![HoldingComment]<>'','$x' & Trim([Holding]![HoldingComment]))

Holdings
Please find the separate sheet for explaination.
